meanings.sent1: She was inured to the long hours of work.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was inured to the harsh conditions of the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: Despite the rain, the hiker remained in good spirits, showing how inured she was to the weather.
meanings.sent4: His heart had become inured to the pain of rejection.
meanings.sent5: The old tree stood tall, its trunk inured to the fierce winds that blew through the valley.

meanings.definition: Toughened or desensitized to something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The detective was inured to the gruesome crime scenes.
meanings.sent2: Having worked in the slaughterhouse for years, he was completely inured to the sights and smells.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so bad that the audience seemed inured to laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her skin had become inured to the rough texture of the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's hands were inured to the constant pull of the fishing nets.

meanings.sent1: The vaccine inured him to the flu virus.
meanings.sent2: The special coating on the car's paint inured it to scratches.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit was inured to bullets and lasers.
meanings.sent4: The new medicine inured her body to the allergic reactions.
meanings.sent5: The castle walls were inured to the battering ram's repeated strikes.
